thread.title: 「逃げ出した牛が乳製品を売り歩いている」警察が警告（画像）
thread.title_full: 「逃げ出した牛が乳製品を売り歩いている」警察が警告（画像）

author: Kazuhiko Kuze
title: 「逃げ出した牛が乳製品を売り歩いている」警察が警告（画像）
text:   Dairy cows eat grass in a paddock on the New South Wales south coast near the town of Nowra, Australia, September 5, 2014. REUTERS/David Gray/File photo A Fonterra milk tanker drives past dairy cows as it arrives at Fonterra's Te Rapa plant near Hamilton, New Zealand August 6, 2013. REUTERS/Nigel Marple/File Photo GLOBAL BUSINESS WEEK AHEAD PACKAGE SEARCH BUSINESS WEEK AHEAD 12 DEC FOR ALL IMAGES Cows are seen on a pastoral farm near Hamilton August 6, 2013. Dairy giant Fonterra was hit by fresh infant formula recalls in China and Hong Kong on Tuesday, while New Zealand's government fretted that the widening contamination scare would prompt China to extend a ban on whey protein powder to other dairy products. REUTERS/Nigel Marple (NEW ZEALAND - Tags: FOOD BUSINESS HEALTH ANIMALS) A cow is seen near the fence of a pastoral farm near Auckland August 6, 2013. Fonterra, the world's leading exporter of dairy products, apologised on Monday for a milk powder contamination scare in China that risks tainting New Zealand's reputation for food safety. Dairy produce accounts for about a quarter of New Zealand's NZ$46 billion ($36 billion) annual export earnings. REUTERS/Nigel Marple (NEW ZEALAND - Tags: POLITICS FOOD ANIMALS BUSINESS) Cows are seen near the fence of a pastoral farm near Auckland August 6, 2013. Fonterra, the world's leading exporter of dairy products, apologised on Monday for a milk powder contamination scare in China that risks tainting New Zealand's reputation for food safety. Dairy produce accounts for about a quarter of New Zealand's NZ$46 billion ($36 billion) annual export earnings. REUTERS/Nigel Marple (NEW ZEALAND - Tags: POLITICS FOOD ANIMALS BUSINESS) Dairy farmer Keith Trotter stands in a field near milking sheds amongst his herd of cows on his farm in the town of Matakana, located north of Auckland, New Zealand, September 24, 2015. New Zealand dairy processor Fonterra increased its milk price payout forecast and reported a 183 percent rise in full-year profit on Thursday amid a modest recovery from this year's plummet in global dairy prices. The world's largest dairy exporter said net profit after tax was NZ$506 million ($317.36 million) in the year to July 31, compared with NZ$179 million a year ago. REUTERS/Nigel Marple Cows stand on a meadow in front of a 10,5cm gun of the former artillery fort of the Swiss Army in the town of Faulensee, Switzerland October 19, 2015. Artillery fort Faulensee was in military use from 1943 to 1993 and is now open to the public as museum. Picture taken on October 19, 2015. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann The headquarters of commodities trader Glencore is seen behind a cow in Baar, Switzerland, September 30, 2015. Lenders remain supportive of embattled commodities trader and mining company Glencore , which has around $13 billion of liquidity available and can finance its debt maturities for two years, sources familiar with the situation said on Tuesday. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann A cow stands on a meadow during a training session of Switzerland's national soccer team in the central Swiss town of Weggis May 26, 2014. The swiss national soccer team will prepare for the FIFA Brazil 2014 World Cup in a training camp in Weggis from May 26 to June 1. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann (SWITZERLAND - Tags: SPORT SOCCER WORLD CUP ENVIRONMENT ANIMALS) ST. ANTOENIEN, SWITZERLAND - AUGUST 04: A cow stands along the southern Raetikon Hoehenweg trail near the Schweizer Tor pass in the Raetikon mountain range on August 4, 2016 near St. Antoenien, Switzerland. The Raetikon mountains, part of the Central Eastern Alps, straddle the borders between Liechtenstein, Switzerland and Austria in a region where a break-away African tectonic plate has clashed with European sheets, resulting in a rich geology that fosters a wide variety of wildflowers. The mountains, with their Sulzfluh and Schesaplana peaks, are also a popular destination for hikers and climbers. (Photo by Sean Gallup/Getty Images) ST. ANTOENIEN, SWITZERLAND - AUGUST 03: Cows lie on a meadow behind the Drusator peak in the Raetikon mountain range on August 3, 2016 near St. Antoenien, Switzerland. The Raetikon mountains, part of the Central Eastern Alps, straddle the borders between Liechtenstein, Switzerland and Austria in a region where a break-away African tectonic plate has clashed with European sheets, resulting in a rich geology that fosters a wide variety of wildflowers. The mountains, with their Sulzfluh and Schesaplana peaks, are also a popular destination for hikers and climbers. (Photo by Sean Gallup/Getty Images) SATTEL, SCHWYZ, SWITZERLAND - 2015/08/25: Hilly agricultural landscape with mountains, green meadows and some cows, one cow as close up. (Photo by Frank Bienewald/LightRocket via Getty Images) Switzerland. Canton Ticino. Robiei. cows. (Photo by: Hermes Images/AGF/UIG via Getty Images) Switzerland. Canton Ticino. Robiei. cows. (Photo by: Hermes Images/AGF/UIG via Getty Images) Switzerland. Canton Ticino. Robiei. cow. (Photo by: Hermes Images/AGF/UIG via Getty Images) Switzerland. Canton Ticino. Robiei. cows. (Photo by: Hermes Images/AGF/UIG via Getty Images)  シェア
